intro: Aethionema kopetdaghi, commonly known as the Kopetdag rockcress, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It is a small, perennial herb that typically grows in rocky or arid environments. The plant produces clusters of small, yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and it has a compact growth habit. Aethionema kopetdaghi is adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
